CatDescriptText: Cutline of article by Tolki Schalk Johnson, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 2, 1960, pg. A9 reads: "Brotherhood Food Festival Is Tremendous Success - Displays Are Beautiful; Food Delicious and Exotic - Pittsburgh saw and enjoyed thoroughly, one of the most exciting events in clubdom's history last Saturday in Hotel Penn Sheraton. The first Brotherhood Food Festival produced by the Pittsburgh Chapter of the National Council of Negro Women, made an impact on our town which left those who took part...and those who were guests...stunned by its magnificence."
TitMainTitle: Three women wearing Asian style dresses, standing behind University Chinese Club table with slippers and dolls, in Penn Sheraton Hotel for Brotherhood Food Festival
